Risk is Probability multiplied by Impact. Risk = P*I.
Once the likelihood has been determined (P), the next step
is to determine the magnitude of impact (I).
The most important factor for mitigation strategy is to
rank the risk on the basis of probability and impact.
Ranking the risk helps the organization determine priority
and resource allocation to address the top level risks.
